page.title: 12Mr Benson The Publican
page.content: The Becket Arms pulic house has been in Corringham since 1852. Mr Benson has lived in the village for thirty years. Mr Benson starts his day at eight-thirty. The opening times of the public house are ten-thirty to two-thirty and six-thirty to eleven-thirty. He gets a moderate trade, selling his draught ales, Scotch bitter, mild, Whitbread bitter, larger and cider. The public house encourages pastime activities and donates prizes to the darts and dominoes league as well as collecting for the blind and kidney research. Mr Benson likes his pub because of the friendly atmosphere and quiet bar in which he has a juke box , two video machines and a fruit machine.
